intro: Erodium lebelii, commonly known as the Lebel's common eryngo, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing annual herb with small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are usually lance-shaped and serrated. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Its botanical features make it a characteristic species of the Eryngium genus within the family Boraginaceae.
